Wind power.Description: Wind power utilizes wind turbines to generate electricity.
Wind power is generated by wind farms, which consist of multiple wind turbines.
Wind power is a form of renewable energy that harnesses the power of wind.
Wind power is measured by the speed of the wind, which affects the amount of electricity generated.
Wind power generation is influenced by the direction of the wind, as it determines the efficiency of the turbines.
Wind power involves the assessment of wind resources to determine the feasibility of wind power projects.
Wind power capacity refers to the maximum amount of power that can be generated by a wind power plant.
Wind power is produced through the process of converting wind energy into electrical energy.
Wind power plants are the infrastructure where wind power generation takes place.
Wind power is part of the renewable energy industry, specifically the wind power sector.
